prompt: The Löwenheim-Skolem theorem tells us that:
options: If a first-order theory has an infinite model, it has models of all infinite cardinalities
Every finite set of axioms is consistent
hint: This theorem reveals surprising facts about the sizes of models.
explanation: Löwenheim-Skolem: If a first-order theory has an infinite model, it has models of every infinite cardinality (both larger and smaller). This creates Skolem's Paradox: set theory, which talks about uncountable sets, has a countable model!
visual_concept: FOL can't pin down the 'size' of infinite models. A theory might 'intend' to describe the real numbers but has models the size of the integers.
